website_summaries.verdict: Freestanding 2-pole design makes setting this tent up a breeze. The durable fiberglass poles with aluminium connectors are sturdy and easy to assemble.
pros: 4 windows provide a great airflow to keep cool fresh air coming into the tent during summer months
Included in the design are mesh storage pockets and a gear loft to keep your kit off the ground
cons: Some users find the tent to be heavy for its size

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Spacious
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a little extra space for two-person camping and this tent fits the bill. Easy to set up, even with one person, as the poles aren't threaded through the fabric, but use external clips, which is excellent. The double door design is also helpful to allow entry or exit without having to crawl over your tent mates every time you need to go to the bathroom or whatnot. Some other colors would be nice, but it does what it needs to with good material and design.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Very easy & comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! One camping trip so far. It was easy to put together. I loved having the little pockets inside as well as the little "hammock" removable net storage place at the top. I like that we each had a door, so no crawling over one another. I would say that it would be quite tight with 3 adults. For two of us, we're on the small side, it was great & roomy. On a superficial note: I thought it looked good out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Quick to set up
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent out for a two-night camping trip. It was cold the first night, but there was no condensation! We also set it up in the dark and it was very quick and easy. The second night was warm and we left the windows open to provide more circulation. My only complaint are the zipper guards around the bottom of the door. They probably really help to keep moisture out, but they are a pain to zip around.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical since this tent is so much cheaper than others out there, but I was surprised when it arrived: probably the best tent my husband and I have ever owned. It is sturdy, spacious and made of good materials. Setup took us 10 minutes and taking it down took even less time than that. There are two doors opposite to each other, and there is a window above each which can be zipped open to get fresh air. Everything fits nicely in the sack that came with it. Some reviewers mentioned that this tent is not for hiking trips, but I think we could bring it with us next time without a problem. Can't wait :)!
customer_reviews.author: Mia Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Well made. Love the design. The price was very fair and the reviews online made this an easy choice. This tent is very easy to set up and take down. It will keep you dry in the rain and still provide good ventilation on those muggy summer nights. This one is a winner. I did a lot of research before buying this one. There are better tents at a higher price point, but value wise, this one is tough to beat. Room for two adults comfortably. Split the weight if backpacking, and you will love it as we do.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in MN

customer_reviews.title: Good value, easy assembly. Practice at home before going out to camp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent for the price. Plenty of room for 2. 3 adults will be tight. No leaking issues during a 6 hour mild downpour at a home trial. While it could be used for hiking, it does weigh 9 lbs. My ultimate use is canoeing/ camping with some portaging. While having my backpack on, I am going to carry the tent in an Atwood 20L dry bag with a shoulder strap when portaging
customer_reviews.author: Ray from Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: It has all the things you want with a lower price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent easy to put up, and love the color and features. I agree it really is a two person tent. I believe the cost is less because the fabric is not as thick as tents made to last for many many years. If you only camp a few times a year I recomend this tent. floor is super thin so would recomend buyind the floor cover as well as a ground cloth
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: It would be a VERY small 3 man tent
customer_reviews.text: I set It set up very nicely by myself in short order. There were heavy rains and hail in the night. There was on leaking at all. The tent is very well made. The seams are all sealed nicely. fabric patch material is included. I bought heavier stakes in case of high winds
customer_reviews.author: old car guy

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, not the lightest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tent for a backpacking trip; wanted to fit 2 adults and 2 75# dogs. The tent was spacious and could fit everyone (people, fur babies, packs), however, it was quite heavy given its size. We opted in taking an Ozark one-door, 4-person tent since it was about 2-3 pounds lighter and fit in the pack easier. The bag carrying the tent was larger, thicker, heavier, and cumbersome. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: FierceUshi

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an older tent that require to run the poles throught sleeve. To take it down, I have to push the poles through and very cumbersome. I hate to pitch the tent while camping. This new tent, took me less than five minutes. Align the poles all four corner, pickup the center, hook the center tent to center of both poles, every much done now. The rest is hook up the tent from outside, no more sleeve. Good for car camping, but little bulky and heavy for backpacking. I have a cod inside and great for myself. Comfortable for 2.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Works but issues with manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this tent 3 time because of manufacturing issues. None had any effect on the function if the tent but they make me worry about the long term quality. 1st tent did not have loop/toggles down in the correct location for opening up the door window. The 2nd and 3rd both had issues with the gear loft. We did use the tent once and through 4 hrs of rain everything was dry and nice. I did not love that it did not include a larger rain fly to cover a small exterior vestibule.
customer_reviews.author: gorffrey berlin

customer_reviews.title: Great tent thats inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I just recently got back from a 10 day camping vacation. Were on the road a lot and set up/took down camp just about every night. Easy to put up and take down. The last night of camping there was a small tornado that went through the park we were in and the tent help up fantastically! Only a few drops of water came through, which was expected. No issues with the poles in the wind, rain fly did its job. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: The ALPS Mountaineering Meramac 3-Person Tent worked well. It was easy to set up and withstood some 20 mph gusts of wind. The only complaint I had with it is that the main door did not have a separate screen door. The screen is part of the main door and only goes down half way. A minor irritation is the fact that the bottom of the tent is susceptible to wind coming into the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo E. Huezo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and take down, even with only one person. I camped on a very windy hill, and the tent held up fine. Very satisfied with this purchase. (A word of caution for Burning Man attendees, though: I don't recommend this tent for the playa, because the mesh screen sides will do nothing to keep out dust.)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. Rain fly actually protects against rain and strong wind. It does block any breeze, too, so it will get hot if you're not in a shaded area. Taking off the fly will not afford you much privacy so maybe not the best for summer music festivals.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2 + baggage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, affordable tent for two people plus their bags. It was pretty easy to put together and take down, and didn't take up that much space.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great company!
customer_reviews.text: We bought multiple of these tents for our boy scout troop. We camp a lot and the boys are not always the gentlest with the equipment. The tents have worked great and held up well. One arrived with a manufacturing defect on the rain fly. We contacted the company directly. They were awesome to deal with! Will definitely buy our gear from this company again!!
customer_reviews.author: mommaduck

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to setup and had plenty of room for two ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once in Northern New Mexico in September. It was easy to setup and had plenty of room for two people. It would be tough to fit three people in this tent. It rained a small amount, and no moisture got inside. It seems pretty sturdy and I really have no complaints. I like this tent.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Tent is great value for the money. It is easy to setup and spacious. Material blocks rain perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I was able to easily figure everything out and had the tent up in ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once for camping in Death Valley. The weather was cold but otherwise calm so I can't speak to how the tent holds up in rougher weather. This was my first time solo-camping, my first time setting up a tent alone, and I arrived in the dark. I was able to easily figure everything out and had the tent up in no time! It was really spacious for just myself, I think it could easily hold 2, 3 might be a bit snug.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie L Lemerand

customer_reviews.title: I was 100% satisfied with the value of this tent
customer_reviews.text: Just back from my first camping trip with this tent. Taking into consideration the price I paid for this tent; I was 100% satisfied with the value of this tent. Easy to setup and breakdown. Everything was or worked as advertised. Perfect for the recreational car camper.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Couch

customer_reviews.title: Very good tent for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tent for 3 people, though I have used it only for myself so far. It is easy and quick to set up and wind up. It is spacious and sturdy for windy conditions. I will recommend it for light travel and camping expeditions.
customer_reviews.author: Prasad B.

customer_reviews.title: Five star great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent easy to put up. It’s is light weight. This tent is also waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Working
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I thought for the price. Our first use paid off, the rain came hard and quick, campsite was flooding, tent kept sides dry. We had to trench around the tent to keep the water from getting under, but the rain fly provided adequate cover. Easy set up and take down. Zippers are weak, may not last more than a couple years, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Time to Tent
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from our first camping trip in 20 years. Just my husband and me- we're both in our sixties. We set up once in our den to practice but put it up at the campsite in less than 10 minutes. No outstanding weather- no rain or big winds but I felt that it was stable and secure. Loved the ease and access of two doors. Seems like a lot of planning and forethought went into this design.
customer_reviews.author: Luziannagal

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t taken it camping yet but it is easy to set up and for the price it seems ...
customer_reviews.text: Just opened it up in the backyard. Haven’t taken it camping yet but it is easy to set up and for the price it seems like a good deal. The only thing I noticed was the material felt pretty thin. Hopefully it doesn’t rip easily, especially for the material on the bottom that you will be sleeping on. I bought a separate tarp to lay down before setting it up once I actually take it camping. Good room for two adults and one child. A snug fit for 3 adults with minimal gear inside.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES T AHN

customer_reviews.title: Ideal tent for us!
customer_reviews.text: This is an ideal tent for two people. Since purchasing the ALPS Meramac a few months ago, this tent has been used twice now (one for a scout over-nighter) . What is fabulous about this tent? It is a super easy tent to put up (and take down) by my daughter & her ten year old son (two novice campers). I am very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.text: I've been camping for 20 years. I've been a Boyscout and love to camp with friends and family. I've mostly always used Coleman tents. This tent has better features and I can see the better quality. Having 2 doors is very useful. I found the overhead storage nice as well. No need to buy an expensive footprint, just use a blue tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Still perfect after many uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought it several years ago and had used it on campsite and beach. Very good quality and easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent. Can fit up to three - two ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent. Can fit up to three - two adults and a kid. Took to Big bend for several night primitive camping. Handled very well the low temp - negative 14 and high winds. A bit too heavy for long hike / primitive camping. Otherwise, amazing product for what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: TonTonD

customer_reviews.title: Scout camp out
customer_reviews.text: Bought to ultimately gift to my grandson. Used same day it arrived. Great tent little or no condensation. Second night it rained stayed dry. Well made, I have Kelty and Eureka tents, Alps is equal or better quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price! Only had it up 3 days so far but we stayed in rain and heavy dew but woke up dry regardless. I haven't had it in heavy wind yet but it assembles tight and I expect it will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tent...
customer_reviews.text: Love the tent, it's perfect for what I was wanting. Love it.....
customer_reviews.author: JeffK

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I like this tent. Easy to set up, good ventilation and I like that the fly comes down closer to the ground than on some other tents. I bought the tent strictly for me and my Mini-Schnauzer so I don't care that it would never accommodate three persons. The fact is that I have an XXL sized ALPS inflatable cushion that I have to lay diagonally to fit it in the tent which means I couldn't really fit two people in it, but as I said, I never intended it for anyone but me and my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: this tents amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: this tents amazing for the price! i camped the other night in some light rain nothing crazy but still everything stayed dry, i gave it a 4/5 only because when my tent arrived one of the retractable poles did not have its rope inside of it their for it falls apart a bunch when trying to set it up, but its just a mistake on the production end and still works fine when everythings connected
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to put back together in included stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Very quick to set up, easy to put back together in included stuff sack. Only downside I could think of is the lack of included footprint/ground cover sheet which forces one to bring those unwieldy pieces of tarp with. Otherwise, plenty of space for 2 adults + a child or two + couple of backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nikolov

customer_reviews.title: Best Tent
customer_reviews.text: Up until now, I've had only three tent. Coleman, Swiss Army, and Alps. This tent is extremely compact and will accomodate two people comfortably. The material drys up quick and the quality seems very durable. Good job alps!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando J. Seminario

customer_reviews.title: it's great. Not good for rocky or thorny soil
customer_reviews.text: Tent is EXACTLY what I need for size limitations when pitched. Not a cold weather tent, so in SE Texas, it's great. Not good for rocky or thorny soil, due to the thin floor. But that makes it lighter and fits my need.
customer_reviews.author: H.W.N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent, good value for the price. Material quality is average to below average. Tent pitched easily and the inside stayed dry in a light rain storm. Two doors are convenient for entry/exit and loading/unloading gear. Good size for two average adults with gear.
customer_reviews.author: DKOH

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase after having done so much research!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this a few times now for boy scout and cub scout camping. Easy to assemble, and stayed dry inside through a couple of days of rain. As is typical, fits two people. Not really 3.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent car camping tent. Loved the bathtub bottom and double door entry. This is my first tent that actually had two doors, and what a relief it is opening them both up in the morning to let a nice breeze through. This can easily fit three fully grown adults along with a few bags. Definitely not a backpackers tent, but perfect for those looking to set up camp close to their cars.
customer_reviews.author: TBURT562

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tent for its price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for its price... The zippers are substantial and don't feel like they will bind or get stuck. The airflow is excellent and the design of the fly is nice, as well. This fit two people quite nicely (two single air mattresses fit perfectly side-by-side). Lightweight and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Fattori

customer_reviews.title: Quality built
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take up much space in your car or on a motorcycle. Lots of room inside.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Suelzle

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is PERFECT for a single person....there is room for two but it would be tight quarters. I slept in this tent during a torrential downpour and did not get a single drop on me. My tent remained dry and so did its walls. The ventilation is great too. It takes me about 10 minutes to set it up from start to finish. Easy cheesy! And by myself! With any tent, I would recommend getting a plastic tarp for underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Metz

customer_reviews.title: Low cost, great item
customer_reviews.text: Set this thing up by myself in 5 minutes having never done so before. it's huge inside; definitely possible to sleep 3 in relative comfort, but really awesome for 2 plus gear.
customer_reviews.author: R. Q. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for BWCA trips
customer_reviews.text: This tent works perfectly for 2 adults or 3 kids. Granted, the weight is a bit much for backpackers, but it works great for multiple night canoe trips, packs up nicely, sets up quickly. so far, very durable floor. we use a ground cloth underneath the tent since the tent gets used a lot. I guess you could also use a floor saver inside the tent for even longer floor life.
customer_reviews.author: canoe

customer_reviews.title: I love it. The poles clip in instead of having ...
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy for packing. Very well built though and roomy. I love it. The poles clip in instead of having to push them through sleeves, that is a must for me.
customer_reviews.author: trey shomin

customer_reviews.title: Tent took it all like a champ with no altering prior
customer_reviews.text: Camped on a mountain, torrential downpour and high winds. Tent took it all like a champ with no altering prior. I ended up having one of the only dry tents. Easy to set up, easy to carry for the occasional camper. If you are seeking a backpacking tent, there are lighter options.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua K.

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent for basic camping. Too heavy for backpacking ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent for basic camping. Too heavy for backpacking, but OK for short trips. We use this for camping with the kids. Haven't slept in the rain with it yet, but the rain fly seems adequate.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: It's a good tent. The tent pegs are cheap but i'm ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good tent. The tent pegs are cheap but i'm pretty sure that that is a universal factor with all tents. They go through all this trouble to make a nice tent and then include pegs made of compressed aluminum foil and good intentions. Buy this tent then go buy better tent pegs.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Lowrie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent for us
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tent for us! Especially love the convenience of doors on two opposite sides. Interior pockets perfect for keeping phone, flashlight, glasses nearby and easy to find in the dark. Ventilation great. Very, very happy with this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Murray

customer_reviews.title: I am glad i bought it!
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to set up, seems strong and well built, very comfy for two and loved the two doors more than i realized i would! It did not rain during my trip so i cannot speak to that.
customer_reviews.author: bahamatude

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Really like this tent, good size, plenty of room, super easy to assemble and disassemble
customer_reviews.author: mas82647

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very spacious with the 3 person tent, and all around quality with the material.
customer_reviews.author: dbcone

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Easy setup and breakdown, love the double door design, fly goes on quickly, quality construction. Tough to ask for anything more from a tent for under 100 bucks! Btw, I'm a tall guy (about 6'7") and haven't ever felt cramped in this tent with another person, two dogs, and gear bags all in the tent at the same time. I'm not particularly needy when it comes to space though, so that's really a pretty subjective thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, compact, and easy to set up. Alps continues to be one of my favorite brands.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Find
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my Daughter who loves to camp. Easy to put together and spacious enough for 3 people to sleep or 2 people if you want more room in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Drea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not one drop of rain into the tent during 2.5 month camping trip! BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed to find that there is no nylon to zip ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find that there is no nylon to zip shut the side "window" areas...so if it is cold and windy, the wind just blows under the fly and through the tent! Chilly!!
customer_reviews.author: office gal

customer_reviews.title: Love the two doors and the big screens
customer_reviews.text: Love the two doors and the big screens. Goes up in less than 3 minutes. Breaks down and fits in it bag just as quickly. Lots of room.
customer_reviews.author: flyfishinwoman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Used it in almost all weather (not snow yet). Is very breathable, sets up fast, keeps ya dry in the rain but not if it is windy too. Good quality for the money!
customer_reviews.author: MrBass

customer_reviews.title: good nights rest
customer_reviews.text: really happy with purchase. i was worried about the cold weather getting in the tent with so much mesh but we really stayed warm and the fly kept the wind out of the tent very well
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for a week at Scout camp. Had some major thunderstorms a couple of days. Rain fly kept me dry even with the window screens unzipped. Only minor complaint I have is the there should be a large hook at the top center of the tent that would clip to both tent poles at the 'X'. Instead the clip is the same smaller size as the other ones on the tent. We own other ALPS tents and they have the larger clip to grab two poles at any junctions. Little too short on the long end to put a cot in.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, water proof
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed. This tent was fast to set up was water proof through two storms. It was shared by two tweens and was a perfect size for them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: So far we love it! Great design and very very spacious
customer_reviews.text: So far we love it! Great design and very very spacious. It seems very well made and has plenty of ventilation. We are going to use it this weekend, will write more about it when we come back.
customer_reviews.author: Chance & Adri P

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This tent is really good and very well built easiest tent I've ever put up and very spacious. I fit a twin air mattress no problem with a really good amount of space. As far as water repellency it was also very awesome we got around 2" of rain during the trip and this was the only one to stay dry with no u under tarp
customer_reviews.author: peter lopez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 2 person tent for a great value
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Beware of drawing sketch, but mostly great tent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent, but... other reviewers are so right that it is definitely not a 4 person tent. It is tiny. The drawing they used showed 4 people lying crosswise. Without a doubt these are kindergarteners. Only plan on 2 adults and lengthwise. Or 4 kindergarteners. Super easy to put up!!! Super, I mean really easy. That's why I got it. I'm a 5'3" female and have to do setup by myself. It was a breeze even the 1st time! A must for me...has a full rain fly, why even bother with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: MamaDog

customer_reviews.title: This tent is perfect for two people
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfect for two people. I was able to assemble it very quickly with the help of my 4 year old daughter, so there's certainly something to be said about that. The windows do not have a solid zipper enclosure, so if you want privacy you need to install the rain fly. Personally, I like being able to see the wildlife around my tent and the cross breeze is usually welcome on warm nights.
customer_reviews.author: smithb

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent for the $$$!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great purchase for the $$$. It is a perfect fit for my husband and I, and our Australian shepard (although we hardly had any gear in the tent). We arrived at camp at dusk the first time we used it, yet it went up quickly and easily. This is a great little tent!
customer_reviews.author: Amy E M

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. We spent two weeks traveling and camping ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. We spent two weeks traveling and camping Colorado during the summer using this tent. Perfect size for two adults to sleep comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Monte

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this tent for the first time this past weekend. It was a breeze to put up and take down. I had zero issues with condensation and we were camping in below 30 degree weather. The two gear pockets and overhead gear storage came in handy too. This is hands down the best tent I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the money. Light and easy to setup. Performed very well in a nasty thunderstorm. I really like the side screens close to where you sleep - perfect for summer camping. The fly also works very well and stays separated from the tent without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Allen

customer_reviews.title: nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quickly ,Seems to be a nice tent . I was able to put it together in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Good canoeing tent
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent. Folds up very small and light weight. Goes up easily.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for average campers (a couple of times a year) - at least, this is how WE use it.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product!! Has lots of ventilation - so great.
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Car Camping Tent
customer_reviews.text: Used for the First Time this past weekend, Awesome Car Camping Tent!
customer_reviews.author: W M

customer_reviews.title: Easy up, lots of room, easy down
customer_reviews.text: This may be considered a 3-person tent but I think of it more as a roomy, 2-person tent. With 2 Thermarests on the floor, there "might" have been room for a third but really was only enough for our gear. The construction seems durable. It was a breeze to pop-up and take-down was easy since there was plenty of room in the carrying bag. For a couple going car-camping, this unit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Juanzelli

customer_reviews.title: ALPS 3 PERSONS TENT
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and very roomy. One person can do this set up in just minutes. Did not have a chance yet to test it in rainy or windy weather but I'm sure it will be just fine. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Francoise

customer_reviews.title: Used it first time I ever went camping. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it first time I ever went camping. It was simple to set up and spacious for two people inside.
customer_reviews.author: IWW99

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tent is just what I needed and is serving me very well. Thanks Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lethea A. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Super easy to set up and tear down, plenty of room, and enjoy the two door system! I did purchase a tarp to put under the tent because I never feel the base is strong enough and it also helps to keep moisture out.
customer_reviews.author: Robby Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Used it for an overnight 126.4-mile trail relay in the Texas Hill Country. And even though I only got 2-3 hours sleep that night the tent was a perfect size for me and all my gear with plenty of room for me to change between relay legs.
customer_reviews.author: James E Jessup

customer_reviews.title: Double zips are perfect for multiple people in the tent
customer_reviews.text: Enormous. Double zips are perfect for multiple people in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Heydt

customer_reviews.title: but the quality is good. Good ventilation for summer
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to test it out on the rain or cold weather ; but the quality is good. Good ventilation for summer. Easy to set up. I like the double doors. Good tent for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: ... this for a birthday present he was well [pleased great quality tent its a shame you can only buy ...
customer_reviews.text: My son camped in one of these when he travelled around the US I brought this for a birthday present he was well [pleased great quality tent its a shame you can only buy from the US. Great seller I would use them again
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bailey

customer_reviews.title: The material is light weight and comes in a great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Took the tent out camping as soon as it came in the mail. The material is light weight and comes in a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect 2 person and a handful of gear tent. Quick set up and the rainfly covers the entire sides. Nice neutral color too. Love the gear basket and other stash pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Swedman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to setup and take down. My son is using it this fire season in Oregon working as a wildland firefighter. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent several times and it keeps you dry and comfortable. It will hold 2 people well but I he it for just me and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Marazita

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and I like that the fly is physically separated from the tent. I also love that you don't have to thread the rod through a sleeve. That is a pain in the neck for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tent worked well. Tent bag zipper broke upon first use.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, Super-Easy To Put Up!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent!! Easy to put up and roomy!!! It says "3-Person" but really this is big enough for two people. I travel on motorcycle by myself and was considering a 2-person version of this, but went with the 3 person so I had enough room to bring the gear on my bike into the tent!
customer_reviews.author: Zatoichi101

customer_reviews.title: I liked this tent very much and it is big for 3 people
customer_reviews.text: Super Fast international shipping than you!!. It took me about 5 minutes to set the tent up and it is bigger than I was expecting, you can easily put a queen size mattress in there...could be for 2 adults and 2 children...and a dog, no problem. I still haven't used it but it looks like a good quality tent.
customer_reviews.author: Maria VA

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to test it out in the field but I did set it up at home and it was exactly what I expected it to be. Well made with great materials. Found nothing to complain about, great tent from a great brand. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Juan de Tlatlaya

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating set up
customer_reviews.text: Not a 1 man set up. Over head cross beam does not fit the 2 pockets designed for. Had to rebuild. Better brands in true camp store.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Manzotti

customer_reviews.title: It's a good, spacious tent
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, spacious tent. A downside is that the waterproof top sheet isn't large enough to cover the sides of the tent (there's a triangular open section on either side). If it's windy and rainy, this can lead to some water coming in through the sides (which could have been avoided with a larger top sheet)
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Door ripped in several places on first night of use. Extra material included for repairs should have been a clue that it was prone to tearing. I didn't expect a great tent at this price but was still disappointed. Setup and takedown is simple though.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: It is not a bad tent for a single person or backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I have been a camping enthusiastic for over 40 years and bought this tent for camping with my grandson at cub scots events. The tent is advertised as a three persons tent, but unless the manufacturer was referring to small childs, the tent barely has room for two persons with minimal equipment. The floor of the tent is so thin that you may want to use a heavy tarp to sit the tent over. Likewise, while streching the tarp, one of the tarp seams ripped apart. It is not a bad tent for a single person or backpacking, but it is one that would not last long due to the below average manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. It might be ok for camping, but not for backpacking. quality is okay.
customer_reviews.author: SteveMc

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Meramac 3-Person Tent
feature_bullets: Easy assembly with a free-standing, two-pole design and shock corded fiberglass poles
Polyester fly resists water and UV damage, while providing an awning over each door
Fully equipped with storage pockets, gear loft, steel stakes, guy ropes, two awning covered doorways, two zippered windows and large side mesh panels
The ALPS Mountaineering Meramac Tent is on our best sellers list; a perfect tent for your next adventure
Base Size: 6'6 x 7'6, Center Height: 52", Total Weight: 9 lbs. 5 oz., Color: Sage/Rust
